title: Ticket #956: We should have a backtrace log
description:
We should have a subsystem dependent log file devoted strictly to backtraces. The dprintf system could keep a cyclic buffer of N lines in the current debugging modes so that when the back trace happens, those N lines plus the backtrace get emitted to the file with demarcation lines around it. Then one can simply look at the backtraces as they happen with a little bit of context without having to dig around in much faster rotating logs.

This is a regular log file and would rotate normally.

The purpose of this would be catching bad, but not fatal, semantic misunderstandings in our code base. Examples follow:

  • calling scheduler_timeout() inside of itself produces a backtrace, but we don't EXCEPT
